article.headline: Furman 69, UNC-Greensboro 59
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Forwards Alex Opacic and George Brozos recorded double-doubles to lead Furman past UNC-Greensboro 69-59 in a Southern Conference game here Sunday. Opacic had game-highs of 19 points and 13 rebounds and Brozos contributed 18 points and 10 boards as the Paladins (5-19, 4-11) posted their largest victory margin of the season and their third win in the last seven games. Kyle Hines scored 15 points, four under his team-leading average, and Kevin Oleksiak added 11 for the Spartans (13-9, 7-6), who dropped their third straight. Opacic and Brozos each netted 11 in the first half as Furman built a 24-13 lead on Opacic's tip-in at the 8:27 mark before UNC-Greensboro rallied to close the gap to 32-30 at intermission. The Paladins regained control early in the second half, going ahead 44-36 on two Brozos free throws at the 15:44 mark. The Spartans pulled within one at 46:45 on Dwayne Johnson's runner in the lane at 10:24, but Connor Nolte's 16-footer on Furman's next possession ignited a 14-4 run for a 60-49 lead with 3:20 left in the game. The Spartans were beset by poor field goal shooting, converting just 31 percent in the first half and 29 percent in the second. UNC-Greensboro made just seven of 34 from three-point range in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
